result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold D White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay fine of $250.00 plus costs, fees and assessments.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
All costs, surcharges and assessments (including the DNA surcharge) to be paid by 60 DAYS to convert to a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harold D White

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Harold D White in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Pay fine of $250.00 plus costs, fees and assessments.

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 60 DAYS to convert to a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

Court vacates the 08/22/2022 Jury Trial.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Harold D White in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Final pretrial held. Defense requests a plea/sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 37 on 08/22/2022 at 9:00 a.m. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Harold D White in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Harold D White appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.    Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/23/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SK.

Defendant Harold D White in court.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Harold D White
Current: 6550 N 80th Street #317, Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 03-21-2022)
Prior: 4113 West Hampton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/21/22 @ 1:30p
